back: The collection of all countable unions, intersections, and complements of intervals.
The collection of Borel sets.
A function that maps from the sample space $S$ to the real line $\mathbb{R}$.
The set of values a random variable can take on.
RV with a finite or countably infinite range
Function from range of a discrete RV $X$ to probabilities, $p_X(x) = \operatorname{Pr}( X=x)$.
Let $(S,\mathcal{F},P)$ be a probability space and $X$ be a real RV on $S$. Then the cumulative distribution function (CDF) is the real function $F_X(x) =P (X\le x)$.
A staircase function is a piecewise constant function of its argument that has at most a countable number of pieces.
Let $(S,\mathcal{F},P)$ be a probability space and $X$ be a real RV on $S$. Then the survival function(SF) is the real function $S_X(x) =P (X > x)= 1 -F_X(x)$.
RV with a finite number of values, all of which have the same probability
RV with two values. Usually 0 and 1, with $p$ such that $P(B=1) = p$ and $P(B=0) = 1-p$.
RV representing number of successes on $N$ independent Bernoulli($p$) trials. $P(N=k) = \binom{N}{k} p^k (1-p)^{N-k}$, $k=0,1,\dots,N$
For repeated, independent Binomial($p$) trials, RV $G$ is number of trials to first success.  $p_G(k) = p(1-p)^{k-1}$, $k=1,2,\ldots$
Models events that occur randomly over time (or space). If average of $\alpha$ events in observation window, \[p_X(k) = \frac{\alpha^k}{k!} e^{- \alpha},~~k = 0, 1, \ldots\]
RV with uncountably infinite range and continuous CDF
For a continuous RV $X$, \[f_X(x) = \frac{d}{dx} F_X(x)\]
A function that has a different functional relationship on different regions of its variable(s).
An RV on an interval $[a,b]$ that has the same probability density at every point in that interval, \[f_U(u) = \frac{1}{b-a}, ~~ u \in [a,b] \]
RV with single parameter $\lambda$ that controls exponential roll-off of density. The pdf is \[ f_X(x) = \lambda e^{-\lambda x} u(x) \]
Given probability $p$, returns value of $x$ such that $F_X(x)=p$. Can denote as $F_{X}^{-1}(p)$. Also called the quantile function of percent-point function.

RV that often arises from aggregation of random effects. Has parameters $\mu$ (mean) and $\sigma$ (standard deviation) and pdf \[f_X(x)  = \frac{1}{\sigma \sqrt{ 2 \pi }} \exp \left\{ - \frac {1} {2}\left[\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma}\right]^2   \right\},\]  \[-\infty < x < \infty \]
A chi-squared random variable with $M$ degrees of freedom is equivalent to the sum of the squares of $M$ independent, standard Normal random variables.
RV similar to standard Normal but has probability spread further from the mean. Spread away from mean increases as degrees of freedom parameter decreases.
